snippet: Alimzhan T. Tokhtakhounov enjoys a life of fine dining, luxury homes and quasi-celebrity status. But American officials call him a top figure in Russian organized crime.
abstract: Internationally recognized Russian Mafia leader Alimzhan T Tokhtakhounov, who is wanted in United States on charges that include fixing skating matches at Salt Lake City Olympics and running high-stakes, trans-Atlantic gambling and money-laundering ring, insists he is legitimate businessman; he lives glamorous lifestyle in Russia, where he has no criminal record.

byline.original: By ANDREW E. KRAMER and JAMES GLANZ
byline.contributor: Andrew E. Kramer reported from Moscow, and James Glanz from New York. Colin Moynihan contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: Alimzhan T. Tokhtakhounov enjoys a life of fine dining, luxury homes and quasi-celebrity status. But American officials call him a top figure in Russian organized crime.

headline.seo: Tokhtakhounov Says Criminal Charges Are Just a Misunderstanding
headline.main: In Russia, Living the High Life; in America, a Wanted Man
headline.print_headline: In Russia, Living the High Life; in America, a Wanted Man
